author: Alan Hilton
text: 'Outrageously expensive.  Terrible food.  Terrible service.'

author: Anastasya V
text: 'I really wanted to love this place all the way. It was cool. It was packed when I got there. Reservations definitely should be made. Ordered the porterhouse for 2
column5: medium rare. Came out more medium. Had a bottle of Caymus and the entrees. Server was awesome but the check had way too many charges that weren‚Äôt even part of our bill. Cash is cheaper than credit. That is stated in the check.\nDefinitely good quality food but not my first choice for food. It was nice but I don‚Äôt feel like I got the best service.'

author: Audrey
text: 'Underwhelming experience. The steak quality was not prime grade (especially for the price) and many dishes were over salted. The waiter we had was not attentive‚Ä¶ was strange because we ate early and it wasn‚Äôt crowded yet. Disappointed because there are many good reviews and we went for a special occasion. Indoor ambiance had good vibes.'

author: John Quinn
text: 'Nice place. A little pricey in my opinion.'

author: johncz100
text: 'Terrible service. I really wish Hoboken had a solid steakhouse and Dino and Harry‚Äôs could/should be that spot but it‚Äôs not. The steak is often not cooked propped and the service leaves MUCH to be desired. They act as if they are a Michelin rated restaurant as opposed to a standard steakhouse‚Ä¶which is disappointing'

author: Ella ÿ™
text: 'Truly remarkable steak house
column5: very comfortable atmosphere and beautiful view. The filet mignon was excellent
column6: and perfectly cooked. The mac and cheese was a wonderful side
column7: and all in all added to the experience. 5 stars
column8: would highly recommend.'

author: Robert Trujillo
text: 'Cool ambience and fast service. Would go to again.'

author: Dave Reed
text: 'The food was great
column5: my experience was terrible. When I tried to pay with my credit card + a Visa gift card
column6: I was told they don\'t accept Visa gift cards (with a chip).\n\nWent to the manager to vent a bit
column7:
was told by my waiter (didn't realize he was also a manager) that it's ridiculous that I would go to a place like that if I can't afford to pay for it."

I asked if they were the only restaurant that doesn't accept Visa gift cards. His response: "I wouldn't know. I only go to restaurants I can afford to pay for."

Wow... surprised to say the least. His arrogance was unreal. Great food
column8: never again for me.'

author: Gregory Ford
text: 'First timer & had a wonderful experience. Staff were extremely friendly & helpful. Got the petite filet mignon & dyanne. Flavoring was alright but quality was amazing. Looking forward to coming back.'

author: Stella Reyes
text: 'Excellent service
column5: loved the atmosphere - great for the two of us.  The menu remained the same after Covid - thankful.  We trust this place!'

author: Brianna Strzezek
text: 'If I could give 0 stars I would because they don‚Äôt even deserve 1. WHERE DO I EVEN BEGIN? Came here for my boyfriends 30th birthday and the night went south FAST. Dino has a fantastic piano that my talented boyfriend decided to get up and play and the whole restaurant was loving it. Next thing we know Dino (the owner) comes over slams the piano cover on my boyfriends hands and screams in his face ‚Äú Do you know who I am? I‚Äôm Dino
column5: get your hands off my piano.‚Äù For context he did this to my boyfriend in front of the other 17 people we were with and made a huge scene in front of the restaurant. The way we were addressed was absolutely disgusting and so embarrassing for an owner of a restaurant to talk to us like this. He ruined the entire night.  Fortunately for Dino we took our business elsewhere. I absolutely do not recommend this place and I cannot comment on the food because Dino screamed at us before we even ordered any food. If you are looking to get on the piano at dinner Dino and Harry‚Äôs is NOT the place for you!'

author: Curtis Berger
text: "Dino's is the best!  Great servers who remember you.  Bartenders are the coolest and make amazing cocktails.  And the Branzino...fugettabatit!  This is the place for a date or an amazing family evening!  Don't miss the live music friday nights...Great vibes..."

author: Ally Esposito
text: 'Would not step foot in here again. Gives vibes of an old musty basement with a bunch of older women staring at you.'

author: Daniel deCavaignac
text: 'Friday night dinner outside for 4 in September.   Food was good and porterhouse for 3 was well cooked.  However
column5: the bill contained a $30 fee for paying with a credit card.  Really?  We spent $377 on dinner for 4 and we are getting charged a giant fee? And without communication.  Not ok.  Will not return.'

author: Luis Londono
text: 'Server offered us cheese on our fries
column5: trying to be nice
column6: but was quick to charge us $6 each for it. You can serve good food
column7: still make your money without deceitful practices. Parmesan cheese does not cost $6 per serving.'

author: Luis Hernandez
text: 'Exquisite taste to fantastic service....my utmost appreciation to Mr. Garcia and his hostess Elli...from tapas to entreas to amazing cocktails Dino and Harry never disappoints!! I would like to express my thank you to jorge @jvbicycles for their reference!!! Unforgettable evening!!!!'

author: Dave M.
text: 'Amazing experience
column5: top notch food and service that surpassed my every expectation! :)'

author: David Rosensaft
text: 'Lovey place and atmosphere. Attentive service.  A bit overrated
column5: though.  Onion soup was just OK and lacked the depth of flavor one would expect for the price and at this caliber of dining experience.    Cod was excellent
column6: although the sauce lacked character or much flavor.  Key lime pie was presented beautifully but was a bit too sweet and lacking in lime flavor.  I might go back and try their steak next time.'

author: Arnaud Tinet
text: 'My go to in Hoboken. Excellent service'

author: Cheyo&Ede
text:
'(Translated by Google) Excellent place

(Original)
Excelente lugar'

author: Rafael M
text: 'Expensive but I guess you pay for the good quality of the food steaks are impressed yummy!
column5: Anything in this place is so delicious my goodness ü•µ'

author: Amanda Silverstein
text: 'My favorite restaurant in Hoboken. It is always a great dining experience with a lovely atmosphere and incredible food. It is not a cheap spot
column5: but well worth the money.'

author: Joseph Siri
text: 'The veal parm was one of the best things I‚Äôve ever eaten.'

author: Michael
text:
'Celebrated a party for a family member here.  14 guys.  The staff were fantastic! Our waitress was constantly checking on us. Drinks were always full.

Dino was such a gentleman and really accommodated the large group.  The food was great. Most people got steaks . I really thought the apps were good as well. The clams   seemed fresh and the shoe string fries are a must have .

I personally really like the ambiance. Feels like you are  in an old school steak house / bar.  More space than I expected .  Fun atmosphere. Also for a steakhouse
column5: I thought the price was not terrible compared to some other less enjoyable restaurants.  It‚Äôs also in the accessible part of of Hoboken where there are parking garages. Highly recommend!'

author: Joaquin B
text: 'Awesome and tasty food
column5: I love the mood this place has
column6: and the workers were kind. Will definitely visit here again.'

author: Judith Herr√°
text: 'Very good service.'

author: mixay s
text: "Rib Eye Steak with peeper sauce was cooked perfectly. Onion soup best I've had anywhere. From entree to appetizer took 50 minutes - restaurant was at 50% capacity. Waiters didnt even come out - had to go in myself to tell them we have been waiting 50 min."

author: Donald S
text: 'The 24 ounce bone in rib eye was tender and juicy'

author: Geomar Sanchez
text: "Made a reservation to celebrate my fianc√©'s birthday. I was looking for a nice vibe with good food. Instead
column5: I was placed at the worst table in the restaurant and when I asked to be moved
column6: I was placed outdoors where the main attraction
column7: the piano player
column8: was inaudible. Next
column9: our server was not friendly and seemed to be in a rush. When we kindly asked for 5 more minutes
column10: they disappeared to the point where we had to reach for their attention. Finally
column11: we hoped the food with be up to our expectations considering this place is NOT cheap. Instead
column12: we were stuck with a burnt 'well-done' steak and a bleeding 'medium-done' ribeye. The overall experience was terrible for a such a nice place in a prime location. At certain points it was nearly impossible not to take the service personally considering we saw other tables with white patrons getting the customer service that we expected at this price tag. I've been to other upscale steak houses in the Edgewater area with 10x better service and food at the same price point. Needless to say
column13: we won't be coming back here again nor do we recommend this establishment."

author: Blesskei Kei
text: 'I love this place
column5: thank u neko for recommending my husband and I to this wonderful placeüòçüòçüòçüòç'

author: Danny Diaz
text: 'Best time ever'

author: Thomas Johnson
text: "Had reservations for a party of 2. We were greeted and seated immediately. We were seated near a window which was nice. Each space was separated with a tall plastic like drape. It didn't take away from the ambience. Shortly thereafter
column5: a server took our drink order
column6: we ordered wine. My date had the blackened Salmon with heirloom tomatoes
column7: she loved it. I had the Rigatoni with spicy sausage and it was delicious and filling. The greeter
column8: wait staff and others were all attentive and professional. I was able to reserve and pay for parking in advance online. It was a block away."

author: Nick Frangipane
text: 'The young hostess was rude. I ordered food for pick up and arrived 10 minutes early (usually food is done before the ticket time) she looked at me with no expression in her face and said your ticket said 6:45 almost shoeing me away. Maybe tell the customer this " your food is not ready
column5: if you\'d like why dont you grab a drink at the bar and ill notify you when its ready". Additionally their steaks are not dry aged. It was like a thin shoprite steak cooked well done not mid rare . Not worth the money.'

author: Frank
text: 'The filet mignons (ordered 8oz medium rare and 10oz medium) and rib eye (ordered 24oz medium) were good. Would have been much better if they were cooked to the correct temperature. We ended up with 8oz medium and 10oz medium rare and ribeye 24oz medium well. When you spend $165 on three steaks
column5: you expect them to be cooked correctly. We were very hungry so we ate what they served us.'

author: Nicole Zabita
text: "Get the porterhouse
column5: you won't be disappointed"

author: Andrew
text: 'Best steak in NJ. No need to go into the city.'

author: Catherine Dixon
text: 'Very old school vibe (depends if you like that or not). Live piano player which was cool
column5: especially in The COVID era. Service started out great
column6: but unfortunately once I started asking questions about the meal due to certain allergies - apparently my hat was inconvenient and our server was no longer gracious. It took 30 minutes to get the bill. I ordered the burrata as an app and the filet
column7: I thought both were average.'

author: Isabella Kapczynski
text: 'I had an amazing night at Dino and Harry‚Äôs!! They were very accommodating while also carefully maintaining all of the safely protocols for covid. We had delicious food and drinks
column5: and what a wonderful ambiance! Thank you so much!'

author: Steven Van Blarcom
text: "We love Dino and Harry's
column5: our go to spot. Great food
column6: service and staff."

author: Reilly Eager
text: 'The food was excellent. Pricey
column5: but well worth it. However
column6: I was very disappointed in the staffs behavior. Their two female hostesses were not wearing masks or facial coverings. They would do so when a customer came in and then immediately took them off and would walk around the restaurant without them. Many staff were not wearing masks either. I did not feel safe there.There is a global pandemic that is not over and I was very disappointed by the staffs carelessness.'

author: James Perez
text: 'Great food all the time Steaks and seafood great service'

author: Ryan Devlin
text: 'Have been here many times. For either cocktails and oysters
column5: guys night out
column6: date night or a family gathering and the food is always amazing. Get the bacon
column7: Hoboken salad
column8: creamed corn creme brulee and the porterhouse for 2. Other great items are the oysters
column9: cocktails and ribeye. I highly recommend'

author: Roberto Borges
text: "Beautiful steak house
column5: great service
column6: best Tomahawk I've had!!!! Can't wait to go back!"

author: Jeena Joy
text: 'What an amazing place to eat! The ambiance is so pretty and relaxing and the food is even better. I made a reservation for my boyfriends birthday this past weekend and we were fully taken care of from the minute we sat down!\n\nMake sure to order the Trio of Empanadas
column5: they‚Äôre delicious
column6: I‚Äôm still thinking about them now. The lamb chops were so good and the porterhouse steak was mouth watering! We ended the night with a chocolate lava cake that melted in your mouth
column7: and definitely filled you up!\n\nThank you so much for such an amazing night and experience
column8: we will definitely be coming back again.'

author: Danielle Red Bonk
text: 'It was a very happy anniversary üéäindeed. Tomahawk ribeye ü•© for two: spot on cooked to perfection. Broccoli ü•¶ rabe: mwah! Better than our Italian grandmas. lyonnaise potatoes: maaadon!!!! And the red wine üç∑ was flowing very nicely! Omg I could eat here every night.'

author: RACS REMODEL
text: 'Outdoor tables still open. Inside is loud. Steaks cooked to perfection.'

author: Michael Granelli
text: 'The food is great
column5: ambiance great and people fantastic. Been eating there for 20+ years.'

author: Helene Hakim
text: 'Had a fantastic dinner
column5: ambiance was great service was on point.'

author: Jose Polanco
text: 'Great food and dining experience.'

author: Scott Mazur
text: 'Corn creme brulee'

author: Darlene Rodriguez
text: 'So good. Service was great and the food was phenomenal. Will be coming back !'

author: Liane McNeil
text: 'Made a reservation expecting to have a top notch fine dining experience.  What we received was poor service with a 5 star price tag. No attention to detail and any part of the meal. No professional table service or wait staff. When food arrived not cooked to order excuses were made and nothing was done. Finally after several attempts to resolve the issue we received a reduction in our bill along with more excuses and continued poor service. Not at all what I would expect when paying over $200 for a party of 3 plus gratuity. We will not be returning nor would we recommend this restaurant to any of our friends.'

author: Brandon Neves
text: 'Excellent staff food and service
column5: the atmosphere has a timeless warmth to it that I really enjoy.'

author: Evan Fusco
text: 'Spectacular dry aged steaks are only the beginning. You could eat there every night and have a very different and equally delicious meal each time.'

author: Patrick Allen
text: "Great food. When I picked up the order the manager told me that I should call in the next time I place an order online and he'll give me a 10% discount. A few weeks later I was ready to place an order for $150 and called in for the 10% discount. I don't know who answered the phone but this guy suggested that: 1. I had already used a code. 2. That I can place my order and he'll look into it in a few days after his day off and he calls the office. I guess business must be great to let $150 walk out the door along with a potential repeat customer. Terrible customer service. Will never call again."

author: Ismail Khallouf
text: 'Old food
column5: bad chef
column6: doesn‚Äôt know how to make the steak
column7: food runner is impolite
column8: the worst service I ever had. They lost biz'

author: Nihad Elco
text: 'This is one of the worst restaurants in jersey
column5: they brought me a plate from a different table which they served by a mistake
column6: and i saw the kid ate from it
column7: and within 3 minutes they brought to me. And wanted to convince me they just made it
column8: and i had remembered a crack on the side of the plate
column9: because other people were in front right of me. Bad service

author: Rayana Aoude
text: 'It wasnt a good experience I went with my uncle and my mother we asked for a porterhouse for two medium well. When we got it from a server it was well cooked so he said he will get us another one 5 minutes later he brought the exact same one thinking we wouldnt notice. But our waiter was rlly nice and was rlly understanding she wasnt the one who gave us the steak. I appreciate how she was trying to control the situation.'

author: Alexandra Ortiz
text: 'Nice place
column5: delicious food‚ô°'

author: Kera Wilusz
text: 'Great food !'

author: Mike Goldstein
text: 'Very good food
column5: but their app for delivery is terrible - just use Seamless or Grubhub or hire a real professional and not some high school kid to make the app'

author: Michael Klein
text: 'I‚Äôve eaten in many steak houses in New York City Chicago Las Vegas etc. and yet I always need to come back to Dino and Harrys as their porterhouse for two is the best of any place I‚Äôve ever eaten.  The rest of the dishes are also excellent and the service is top notch'

author: E.Jason Prince
text: 'Great place for Steak'

author: melissa sheridan
text: "I love this place
column5: we eat here often. I have never had anything that wasn't amazing except for last evening.  I had a chicken salad
column6: which cost $29. The chicken was over cooked
column7: dry and thin. The salad consisted of lettuce that seemed old
column8: tomatoes and mushrooms in an oil and vinegar dressing.  I expected more for the price. But

author: ismail caliskan
text: 'It is great with friends.'

author: Martin D
text: 'Great food and great service.'

author: vijay mehra
text: "Have been many times
column5: typically 4-8 people at a time. The porterhouses
column6: Ribeye's and T-hawks are always great cuts of meat
column7: easy to share...cooked perfectly and sliced
column8: melt in your mouth good. Get a few sides
column9: just tried the creamed corn brulee for the first tume
column10: so good...with some thick cut bacon

author: Charlene Mudge
text: 'Out bartender was the best octopus delish and the piano player played happy birthday to me. So thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è'

author: John Dempsey
text: 'The food is constantly well prepared and delightful
column5: workers gives fantastic customer service. I loved the cleanliness and atmosphere. I highly recommend this spot.'

author: Jason F
text: 'It doesn\'t get anymore "classic steakhouse" than Dino and Harry\'s. Very elegant atmosphere
column5: almost like going back in time with a live piano player. Servers are very attentive
column6: and you can\'t go wrong with anything on the menu. Prices are reasonable compared to most of the top steakhouses across the river. Dry aged cuts are not quite as good as some of the top dogs in the city
column7: but I highly recommend as it\'s one of the best steakhouses in North Jersey. Rib eye was cooked to perfection.'

author: Chris Orros
text: 'Excellent food and drinks'

author: SEAN JEON
text: 'Best steak in North Jersey I believe'

author: Peter Elson
text: 'Excellent food and attentive service and a diverse menu. Everything was excellent.'

author: James Foley
text: 'Great restaurant
column5: excellent good'

author: Melanie Tam
text: "It was my fianc√©'s Dad's birthday and we were looking for a last minute dinner spot after Augustino's gave our table away. We found a reservation for Dino and Harry's so it was perfect - we've been meaning to check it out anyway. It was MLK Jr. Day so it was pretty empty at around 6 pm.\n\nTo start
column5: they brought us the best bread basket ever. It included hot/freshly baked rolls
column6: bread sticks (the crunchy sesame ones)
column7: and flat bread crisps. It was nice that they provided a variety. For food
column8: we ordered a bunch of things to share amongst four people. We ordered the Scallops (roasted cauliflower
column9: Pearl barley with a morel mushroom sauce). The scallops were perfectly cooked but a little too salty. Luckily
column10: the rest of the dish was not. I loved the creamy mushroom sauce. Paired with the Pearl barley
column11: it was very innovative. For steak
column12: we did the 32 oz Porterhouse. The menu says it's for two people but this with the scallops and two sides was more than enough for us. We even had leftovers. The steak was good but pretty oily - probably the reason why we all filled up rather quickly. Creamed spinach and brussel sprouts with applewood smoked b weacon were the sides we picked (all sides are $10 each). The creamed spinach was a bit off to me. For some reason
column13: it tasted minty to me (it was just me though). Surprisingly
column14: I enjoyed the brussel sprouts even though I normally don't like them.\n\nFood was good overall
column15: service was great - definitely don't mind coming back for another special occasion."

author: Travis Aldrin
text: 'Amazingly good ribeye. And the sauteed mushrooms were a perfect addition. Highly recommend.'

author: Mark Todd
text: 'Finest food
column5: nice staff
column6: always  awesome vibes. They charge reasonable pricing and the food quality is very good. Keep it up.'

author: PSmiles
text: "Made a reservation two days before going for three at 2015. 35 mins before arriving I call to ask if they could please decant a bottle of wine I'd selected from their list. Their response
column5: oh sorry your reservation isn't in the system and there's no notes about it anywhere...but they could seat me at 2100. Yea
column6: no thanks. You're not getting a dime from me.  I'd give zero stars of if could. They then tell me well it looks like you've never been here before. I said
column7: um
column8: I've been there twice in the last 18 months. Now I have to tell my girl whose new job we were supposed to be celebrating that we need to find another place

author: Sym Cardnel
text: 'Good ole fashioned authentic
column5: tasty n very expensive food! Only downside was the wingtiped
column6: bow tied absolutely pathetic clientele.'

author: Ludovic MASSON
text: 'Good place ! Service was okay. Food was good except that they messed up totally the cooking and overcooked my tbone and undercook the filet mignon.\nWine list seems interesting.\nWe have been lucky to be in the room on the side
column5: which is quieter than the main room
column6: even if it was only the piano.\nI recommend !'

author: M. O'Connor
text: 'Old style elegance with great menu of well prepared classic steakhouse cuisine. A good choice for couples
column5: friends
column6: and families  who want something a little more upscale/special for their evening out. Their Thursday nights offer live music after 9:30 PM and the atmosphere mellows out for anyone wanting the night to stretch out enjoyably.'

author: Here Comes TaPs
text: 'Nice place'

author: JAMHANDY13
text: 'The food was excellent ! The service was on point. The atmosphere was great. They had a piano man everything just fits so perfect. I would totally recommend going here'

author: Shadi Saweris
text: 'Very expensive for the quality of the food especially the stakes'

author: Jennifer Hildebrandt
text: 'This is the best steak I have ever had...'

author: Eszter Marossi
text: 'Pleasent athmosphere
column5: great steak and calf liver. Great for a date night. Waiter was a little bit awkward but not rude.'

author: Karen Garrity
text: 'Excellent steakhouse.  Never disappoints.  Terrific food and service! Hoboken Gem.'

author: joe Lojo
text: 'Really good steak and sides. Friendly and caring staff.'

author: joha guzman
text: 'Love it'

author: Joseph Caltabellotta
text: 'Very nice place a little too loud on the weekend with all the people drinking around the bar and the piano Aside from that the food was great I laughed I cried it was wonderful'

author: Michael Gioia
text: 'Sad to say our last time at Dino & Harry‚Äôs will truly be our last. My wife and I came here three times - each time we‚Äôve been placed in the same tight back room of the establishment
column5: not in the main dining area. We got seated by the hostess and then immediately approached by our waitress asking for our drink orders. Having not enough time to look over the wine menu
column6: we asked her for an extra minute to make a decision. She didn‚Äôt come back for fifteen minutes. She eventually came back and asked us for our entire order
column7: we obliged
column8: even though I was afraid it would throw off the order of the meal - wine
column10: mains. My fears became a reality when our Caesar salad came out ten minutes before our first glass of wine. Shortly after getting our wine out came our steaks
column11: leaving little time to enjoy either the salad or wine. What came next was a serious problem
column12: far more disconcerting than breaking meal conventions. The steaks we ordered came on top of a bed of diced mushrooms. After a few bites of her steak
column13: my wife‚Äôs face turned from OK to alarmed
column14: as she began pulling pieces of glass out of her mouth. MAY I REPEAT
column15: THERE WAS GLASS IN HER FOOD. It was difficult to track our waitress
column16: and instead we found a busboy. He hurriedly removed the plate without an apology or clue as to what would come next. We told him didn‚Äôt want a replacement
column17: we wanted to speak to someone. After quite a while of us sitting
column20: the waitress arrived saying she‚Äôs going to comp the steak. No apology. No explanation. No offer to comp the meal. The busboy who we told we didn‚Äôt want a replacement steak came back with a replacement steak
column22: and proving the staff were not communicating and lost. There are other options for a steak in Hoboken. Take my advice and check them out first
column23: or eat at your own risk!'

author: Michal Kowalczyk
text: 'Unique place in hoboken! Highly recommend.. staff is outstanding'

author: Isaias Cherry
text: 'Extraordinary vibes and super welcoming service. The menu was crisp and delightful. Will clearly recommend this spot to anyone. Affordable prices and generous portions. Keep up the great work.'

author: Didier Mal√©part
text: '(Translated by Google) You eat well
column5:
for not very expensive. Waitresses and waiters are very friendly. I recommend this place.

(Original)
On y mange bien
column6: pour pas tr√®s cher .les serveuses et serveurs sont tr√®s sympathiques. Je recommande ce lieu .'

author: Floyd Campbell III
text: 'Amazing steak and drinks!'

author: Matt Hiller
text: 'Best of Hoboken'

author: Thomas Whalen
text: 'As usual superb!'

author: Jigar Patel
text: 'Great steak. Porterhouse was perfectly charred. Great value compared to NYC steakhouses.'

author: Joe Dell'Armi
text: "This place is a time capsule. They have one of the best Ribeyes I've ever had in my life
column5: and I've had more than my fair share. Everything about this place - the staff
column6: the service
column7: the notable dishes
column8: the decor
column9: the drinks - could easily be the same as they were 50-60 years ago.  So long as that's what you're looking for
column10: this place is worth the journey from almost anywhere. If you're vegan or have food allergies
column11: you might have a bad time."

author: Alan Rosa
text: "The food is excellent and service even better.  Nice quaint place to meet up for drinks after work or a professional dinner.  They have occasional live music which is well done and not over bearing.  Not five stars as the place needs a facelift - it's a little dark and it's starting to show it's age."

author: Irene Frangos
text: 'Delicious food
column5: amazing service
column6: beautiful atmosphere. Friendly staff. A must.'

author: Marilyn Tomasso
text: 'As usual fantastic dinner!!!!!!\nNew server Dean
column5: especially cordial..'

author: Only cooking Gods
text: 'The ribeye is amazing'

author: Craig Simpson
text: "Right from the beginning the whole experience was a pleasure. Good atmosphere with live music
column5: suitable for the venue
column6:
attentive staff but not over bearing and great food.

Best restaurant we've been to since in New York and New Jersey.

Be warned it ain‚Äôt cheap even by NY standards."

author: Erika Muller
text: 'Amazing food and excellent service
column5: always!'

author: Carlos Fernando
text: 'Great New York Steak with amazing souse. We enjoyed great food and drinks.'

author: Jennifer Timlin
text: 'Great food
column5: pleasant atmosphere! Desert to die for!'

author: Frances Trompeta
text: 'Steaks are cooked to perfection.'

author: Jason Williams
text: 'Food is fantastic
column5: great atmosphere
column6: great service
column7: bring your wallet
column8: very expensive but worth it.'

author: Joe Minuti
text: 'Fantastic steaks. On street parking so be careful where you park.'

author: Gregory Visconti
text: 'The ambiance is befitting the Porterhouae for 2!  My go to place..Thanks Dino'

author: Jazz Klein
text: 'Ordered the 16oz rib eye steak which was flavorful and cooked perfectly. Also had the brussel sprouts with bacon that was so delicious! Just a tad too much salt still enjoyable.'

author: Kevin Champion
text: 'Hosting staff very well'

author: Tony Kenyon
text: 'If you want a bland steak experience this will tick your boxes. Not a memorable place for the service not the quality of the food.'

author: Gary Giarratano
text: 'Totally phenomenal food and service.  The only criticism isit is way too loud inside of this place for it to be considered fine dining'

author: Emilio Ewing
text: 'The customer service is always swift
column5: fantastic character
column6: very friendly staff. I will eat here again when I am nearby.'

author: Karen De Jesus
text: 'Best steaks in the area!!!!'

author: John B
text: 'Easily the best steak place in New Jersey'

author: Theoriginalsave
text: 'Ok'

author: George Herrera
text: 'Excellent experience !'

author: Ted Bougdanos
text: 'Best steaks very good food exalan service'

author: diane gnassi
text: 'Amazing as always... just amazing.   Shrimp
column5: scallops
column6: octopus
column7: T-bones
column8: desserts..... to perfection!   Thank you Dino!'

author: Bradley Gabe
text: "Very sorry to say my fish was overcooked and my wife's filet was small for the money. Service was excellent
column7: not sure if returning

author: Michael Savignano
text: 'Great food staff üëç\nJoe Pescopo... recommend...'

author: Richard Huber
text: "Dino and Harry's is always a masterpiece.  Long tail of history going back to relationships with Frankie and Johnny's and others in the city and Brooklyn. I've been going here from many years.  if you've never been there before you get the porterhouse for two and you ask him to sear it either medium rare or rare and it's the most amazing steak you've ever had"

author: Lance Gross
text: 'I want to start by saying that Genesis( I believe that was her name) the girl at the door is great. She helped us out on the phone and when we got there she was very pleasant and very polite. The food was great and our time there was also great.'

author: Ali Naderi
text: 'Good standard steakhouse. Had the ribeye. Could have been more tender. The sides left a lot to be desired. Had the Mac and cheese and Brussels sprouts.'

author: Bob Woloshen
text: 'Good food'

author: Mike Cobucci
text: "Maybe I'm jaded because I've been to NYC
column5: Vegas and CHI steakhouses but they didn't even pan sear my filet mignon..."

author: Andrea Dunn
text: "My husband took me here for our 25th Wedding anniversary.  We went early on a weekday so the place was empty.    Husband had the octopus appetizer which he said was very good and I had the french onion soup which was tasty.    Corn crem brulee and potato sides were very good
column5: but the corn risotto that came with my husband's fish was out of this world!  Restaurant is a bit pricey but a good choice for a nice night out or special occasion."

author: Jim Farrell
text: 'Fantastic steak'

author: Gilles Guillou
text: 'Great food
column5: service and wine'

author: Alfred Munoz
text: "I couldn't wait to try this place....so disappointed. Sat at the bar..I mean you can't get bad service at the bar right?....wrong! Ordered the T bone medium rare....came out and it looked good
column5: but upon cutting into a tough piece of leather( bad cut of meat) my steak was medium/well done. I was hungry so I was going to tough it out and eat it but the first 2 bites left a bad burnt taste in my mouth. I flipped my steak over and it was black on the bottom. After 20 minutes the bartender finally asked me if everything was ok
column6: oblivious to the fact I only had 2 bites of a $45 steak. He literally argued with me that they char the steak
column7: and wouldn't listen that the steak was so burnt it left charcoal residue all over my plate....buyer beware this is no elite steak..Outback is better."

author: john cunning
text: 'Great great great!!'

author: William Oquendo
text: 'Best steak in NJ'

author: Max Di Biaggio
text: "It's good but not as good as people might think.  @maxandlosamericanos"

author: 13 Ghostz_TV
text: 'Little noisy but good'

author: andrew andrade
text: 'Real great steak very tender'

author: Kyle Mikolajczyk
text: 'Steak was great'

author: Christopher Warren
text: "The atmosphere is great with a live piano player. The staff was friendly but the food left something to be desire especially for the price
column5: but I'm willing to give it another chance. Maybe try something different."

author: Crona Airgid
text: 'Great experience overall. Thank you'

author: Michael Desousa
text: 'Whenever I go here with a friend I get the porterhouse for 3 (medium) spinach and cream and bacon and a couple of salads. BEST STEAKHOUSE IN JERSEY. I‚Äôve become great friends with the really friendly staff over the years
column5: everything from the martinis at the bar to the guy playing piano. I love this place'

author: Vincent Bellucci
text: 'Steak very flavorful. Lively atmosphere.  Service not bad a little more attentive would of been nice but not a reason not to go back.'

author: Greg White
text: 'Loud. Slow service. Decent food'

author: Ready 4 Travel
text:
'(Translated by Google) Epic !!! Perfect steak with scallops and Kalifotnia wine.

(Original)
Epic!!! Doskona≈Çy stek i do tego przegrzebki i wino z Kalifotni.'

author: Sabino Rodano
text: 'One of the best meals I have ever had.'

author: Matt Magrini
text: 'Average good for high prices. The quality of the beef was subpar. Very rude hostess too. Better options out there.'

author: Cassandra
text: 'this place has exceptional service and fantastic steak!'

author: Mike Lembo
text: 'Great Steaks'

author: John Woods
text: 'Fantastic food!'

author: Joe Avino
text: 'just had a great steak here last night highly reccomend'

author: Andrew Toland
text: 'Just fabulous!'

author: Lori Ann Burgos-Kickey
text: 'Great food nice atmosphere pleasant friendly staff'

author: Denis Stypulkoski
text: 'Great place.  Food and service were spot on.'

author: Daniel
text: 'Best steakhouse in Hoboken'

author: belkis proano
text: 'Good food good location'

author: shelley ziegler
text: 'Yummy steak! Try the brussel sprouts.  If you sit in the "side room" the service is very good!'

author: Maylo Barnuevo
text: "Service is so so as well as the steak. It's priced like a high end steakhouse and that's all."

author: Garrett Williams
text: 'Good atmosphere. They have live piano music which is a nice touch. The service was slow
column5: and the food was average. The filets that were ordered at our table were what you would expect for the price
column6: but the ribeyes were not. I‚Äôve had better at lower end chain restaurant. The server was kind enough to remove the steak from the bill. If you‚Äôre on the west side of the river
column7: this is a ok choice. If you‚Äôre looking for an experience like you get in a Manhattan steakhouse
column8: take the time to get across the river!'

author: rosa parra
text: 'Good steak'

author: Rich Maider
text: 'Porterhouse was delicious'

author: Solipsis
text: 'Good food
column5: good service but very expensive for what you get. Totally overpriced.'

author: Fidel Castro
text: 'Food is always on point. Quality
column5: quality meat.'

author: Donna Rayside
text:
"I have been going to Dino and Harry's since it was Frankie and Johnny's for 25 years
OUT STANDING!!TO SAY THE LEAST!!
AMBIANCE*NICE CROWD*PIANO BAR*LIVE MUSIC*ROMANTIC*BEAUTIFUL BAR*GREAT HOSPITALITY
*COCKTAILS SERVED PERFECTLY
*GREAT SERVICE
*EXCELLENT MENUE
*EVERYTHING FROM COCKTAILS TO DERSERT WAS SUPURB!!!
AND DINO OF COURSE IS WONDERFUL!"

author: Jason Oermann
text: 'One of the better restaurants in Hoboken
column5: great steak and service.'

author: Gemini Patriot
text: 'Great place to end your day. Excellent food and service!'

author: Jason Farrugia
text: 'There are better options available
column5: especially in New York.  I was a bit disappointed considering the price.'

author: Birchtree Builders LLC
text: 'Great atmosphere.  Get the Porterhouse for 2 and take home leftovers.'

author: Joseph
text: 'for $55 i expected a high end steak. instead received a tastless piece of prefrozen cardboard drenched in butter.'

author: Cathy Kelleher
text: "Warm
column5: cozy
column6: great menu
column7: I had Salmon
column8: great service and could walk from my daughter's condo! Hoboken is a great dining destination!"

author: Christine
text: "We showed up on time for our 9pm reservation
column5: but the bar and entrance were packed with people still waiting to eat for their 8:30
column6: 8:15 and 8pm reservations. The staff was honestly pretty rude to the other guests waiting and it was clear that the staff was blatantly lying to them about when they'd be seated.\n\nPeople were pretty miserable
column7: and it was clear this wasn't changing anytime soon
column8: so we decided to try another restaurant instead. The maitre d tried to convince us to stay because it had only been 10 minutes since our reservation time. We pointed out that we had just heard her curtly tell someone waiting for an 8:30 reservation that there were still people waiting back from 8. She relented and agreed to cancel.\n\nAnyway
column9: we had an amazing time at Lola's! Hopefully Dino and Harry's can step up their customer service soon
column10: as I heard their food is quite good."

author: Jordan
text: "Food was solid.  The service was abhorrent.  Waited 45 minutes with an 8PM reservation. The hostess was not pleasant or nice at all.  After we ordered
column5: they brought the app
column6: but then they cleared our app early to bring our entree's which weren't ours
column7: so we were left app-less. They forgot to bring our oysters
column8: told them forget it
column9: they brought them anyway.  Then they brought someone elses food to our table AGAIN.  Finally after an hour and 20 our pasta and steak arrived which were both fine.  Then when leaving
column10: the hostess didnt even say goodbye have a nice evening or anything.  The service was terrible.  For what you pay here
column11: I expect much better service.  Especially from the hostess how do you not greet your guests!!!!!!  Would not recommend."

author: J A
text: 'Excellent food and service. Try to get a table by the piano.'

author: bernie nordquist
text: "Awesome...Can't wait to go back..."

author: Spiro Dongaris
text: 'Best steak
column5: excellent service.'

author: Alex
text: 'Been waiting to come back for a steak since June 2016 and it was awesome as usual!'

author: Levy Reyes
text: 'Solid steak.'

author: Carla Maria
text: 'Delicious food and they are on top of their service!'

author: Chaitanya Gohil
text: 'Good Tbone steak!'

author: Joseph Kinsley
text: 'well once again we were not disappointed. food was great
column5: wine selection was great. Table could have been a little bigger for our party but we made it work!'

author: Edward Bolano
text: 'Excellent food and service'

author: GARY G
text: 'Good food'

author: Vlad Yushvah
text: 'Decent steakhouse. Service is ok'

author: Greg Z
text: 'The food was amazing and service was the best!  Great place...'

author: Pumpkin Wells
text: 'Best food ever'

author: Ernest Sciarra
text: 'Best steakhouse in Hoboken great service too bad no parking'

author: Annette Rion
text: 'We made. Reservations we went in and had a cocktail the place was so loud and the piano player was louder he was playing like a lurch in the Adams family we had to leave'

author: Mary Ann Bowen
text: "Steaks excellent and my favorite are the raw oysters!  Wouldn't trust them just any place!!   Every entree and dessert is excellent!  I lived in the neighborhood for over 20 years and went here alot!  Smetimes just for drinks!  Dino and the wait staff remember everybody!  even after we had not been for a few years.  Never dissapointed.  See 1 poster was unhappy with his/her drink...just let them know they will make you one you love!!!"

author: Duncan S
text: 'Food is excellent
column5: prices are a bit too much
column6: $50 bucks for a steak with nothing with it
column7: $10 for a bit of mash on the side.  We were early and there was a family with a noisy baby at the next table
column8: would go back if I won the lotto.'

author: Janelle Hoban
text: 'Excellent martini and French onion soup. Felt a little out of place sitting at the bar between groups of regulars.'

author: Jameson Roberts
text: 'One of the best steaks I have ever had for my birthday. Sides are killer. Service on point. Piano player adds to the atmosphere to make this a great place for a date or social get together. Highly recommended.'

author: J.C. Logan
text: "Went for restaurant week and ordered the filet medallions medium-rare off of the prix fixe. They came well done which was disappointing
column5: but were still flavorful. My fiance got the prime burger which was fantastic. Service was ok
column6: cool atmosphere. Would be 2 stars if they messed up my steak on the regular menu
column7: 4 if they got it right this time. Either way we won't be going back for the $80 porterhouse."

author: Anthony Mazzola
text: "I've been here for special occasions
column5: bachelor parties and get togethers with large groups.  Every time has been a pleasant and memorable experience and the steaks are excellent.  Huge fan of their ribeye and porterhouse.  The staff is attentive and helpful and well."

author: T W
text: 'Loved the food and service. Restaurant could use a deep cleaning and fresh paint.'

author: Sigurd Mannsaker
text: 'Nice place
column5: a bit pricey. Decent steaks but nothing spectacular.'

author: Jason 65
text: 'Excellent place for a steak
column5: prices are a little higher than normal but worth it.'

author: Mikea Anzo
text: "If you like good food with outstanding service look no further than Dino and Harry's they have it all\n\nMike Anzo"

author: William Vargo
text: "Came here with a group of friends for a bachelor party dinner. Most ordered beer
column5: I ordered an old fashioned which was mediocre.  One friend ordered a soda and I watched the bartender use the pint glass to directly scoop the ice out. Men's bathroom had a broken faucet handle. We had several appetizers. The bacon was very good
column6: seemed like it was pork belly. Fried calamari was average. I ordered a rib eye steak. I ordered medium rare but when it arrived it was well done. The waiter did not check on the table until everyone was finished so I could not inform them. Otherwise the steak was well marbled and tasted good. As more sides
column7: mashed potatoes were average and the asparagus was good. There was live piano which was nice. I expected more quality from a restaurant like this."

author: Patti Killeen
text: 'Amazing! Steaks were perfect. ! Full of flavor. Service was friendly and quick! Love the family style option!'

author: Hilary Halliwell
text: 'Great food--the lamb chops were flavorful
column5: tender
column6: and cooked to perfection.  They also have an extensive wine list. For desert
column7: try the "Snoboken"chocolate cookie crumbs
column8: vanilla ice cream and shaved coconut.'

author: Italo Vera
text: 'This place turned a date into a disaster. Had reservations at 9 did not get seated until 09:35 ! Finally got to sit down and the service was even taking a long time just to order.'

author: Brian Hultz
text: 'Amazing!  Dinner was spectacular.'

author: Ish Lamboy
text: 'Great place
column5: amazing food and phenomenal service.'

author: M E
text: "No no no....you don't slice a porter house like it's a brisket and charge people classic steakhouse fees.   One of the better steakhouses in nj but competition is even more disappointing."

author: Dean
text: 'Great steaks
column5: perfect place for a nice date.'

author: Dave Lav
text: 'I challenge you to show me someplace better.'

author: Kapil Nayyar
text: "Food was good. We asked for a quiet place but they gave us a table with a very loud holiday party. We had to leave before the desert...couldn't even hear my own voice."

author: Jeff Thompson
text: 'Good but not great steaks'

author: Red Dacquel
text: 'Great little steakhouse that maintains its old school charm.'

author: Brad Carlsson
text: "Food was good and pretty quick.Our previous visits have been good but today
column5: other than the food a complete disappointment.  Waitress was friendly enough but after taking orders we never saw here again - not to check after the food arrived
column6: not for a second drink
column7:
nothing. Until we were done.

Half way through the meal we asked for a manager and nothing. No one came.

After my wife confronted the waitress she comp'ed a bunch of stuff. So OK
column8:
fine.

On the way out the owner really couldn't seem to care less - a little apology but attitude was really pretty obvious that he didn't particularly care one way or the other - they got busy and we were off to the side apparently...  just excuses...

Spend your money elsewhere."

author: Chaene Rodrigues
text: 'Best STEAKS Ever!!!!!!'

author: Adam Fernandez
text: 'Nice place to celebrate a special occasion. Great service and food. Definitely try the bacon appetizer!'

author: Greg Whipple
text: 'Great steak great atmosphere. Feels like an NYC steakhouse but in Hoboken'

author: Daniel Au Yeung
text: "One of the best and unknown steakhouse (or best kept secret) in all of NYC.  I've been most of the steakhouses throughout NYC like Peter Luger
column5: Morton's
column6: Palm
column7: Old Homestead
column8: Keens
column13: etc.  But Dino & Harry's is still the most memorable.  Get the porterhouse for two with a few sides like the brussels sprout with pancetta and creamed spinach.  You'll leave happy!"

author: Michael Shubick
text: 'Bacon appetizer was great!'

author: desmond j
text: 'The food is at a very up scale level taste
column5: second to none.'

author: Elizabeth Markham
text: 'Great for restaurant week'

author: Alex Harding
text: 'The best time to head here (especially if on a budget) is during restaurant week. Great food (though pricey unless you get the aforementioned restaurant week menu) and drinks. Conveniently located in a nice park of North Hoboken.'

author: Frank Berman
text: 'Always fantastic! Great food
column5: service and atmosphere.'

author: Christopher Galdi
text: 'Steak'

author: Chris Lee
text: "Great steak place. My steak was good but my sides were amazing. Next time I'll get the T bone and then 5 sides! Good service and good atmosphere!"

author: Saul (saulaibonito)
text: 'Great steak house in Hoboken with good food and great service.  Had our company xmas dinner here.'

author: Anthony Pisano
text: 'Loved it.  Great porter house for 2'

author: corrine D
text: 'great food and drinks :)'

author: Silvanna Schell
text: "Amazing!  My family and I went on a Friday and didn't have reservations and they were still able to seat us right away.  The service was great
column5: everyone was friendly.  The food was incredible! The steaks were cooked perfectly and cut like butter.  Cant wait to go back!"

author: Zdenka Hauner-Manley
text: "I celebrated my birthday with my daughter and my husband yesterday at Dino & Harry's. The steak (perfectly done!)
column5: the lamb chops  (huge and delicious )
column6: the calf liver (medium rare splendidly executed with onion and divine bacon) we paired with corn creme brulee  (nice innovative touch)  and other very tasty sides. And Ms.Charlotte
column7: our waitress
column8: was fast
column10: fun to be with. The evening was the total success : fantastic food and great people!  Thanks."

author: Jeremy Gollehon
text: 'This place gets five stars simply for having the best bacon ever. Three giant pieces come with a little maple slaw on top. Try it. Love it.'

author: wayne farren
text: "Food was just ok
column5: I was expecting better. Probably won't be going back."

author: lauren deldotto
text: 'dino & harry is a new york steak house
column5: outside ny.  excellent steaks
column6: flavorful and well prepared
column7: and excellent sides as well.'

author: Marcela Thousand
text: 'Good chops
column5: steaks and huge portions. Loved the alive Beatles music. Better ambience than food.'

author: Brian Baldari
text: 'Great food and wine.'

author: John Veltri
text: "there is no need to pay cash and wait forever for those more famous steakhouse's in brooklyn.  dino's steaks are phenominal and the sides are just as good."

author: John Reichart
text: "Been going to Dino & Harrys for many years and they have remained consistent. The food is very good
column5: the scene is very good and I have never felt over/under dressed because it's not a stuffy place. No
column6: it is not the best steak I've ever had
column7: but it is ALWAYS a really great steak and a really nice place to have a really nice dinner. Keep up the good work Dino & Harry!"
